content:
The recent brouhaha regarding superstar [Kawhi Leonard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawhi_Leonard)'s lucrative agreement with a particular financial institution has, regrettably, been misinterpreted by some as something untoward. Far from being a "no-show" arrangement, as the less imaginative among us might suggest, it was, in fact, a pioneering example of "extreme flex scheduling." A former CEO, a man clearly versed in the intricate ballet of high finance and professional sports, has now clarified this crucial distinction.

One must appreciate the nuanced demands placed upon an athlete of Leonard's caliber, particularly when navigating the competitive landscape of the [Los Angeles Clippers](https://www.nba.com/clippers)' aspirations under the meticulous eye of owner [Steve Ballmer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Ballmer). To expect a man of his unique talents to consistently adhere to rigid public appearance schedules would be, frankly, an imposition. This innovative contract allowed for unparalleled efficiency, ensuring maximum brand exposure through... well, through his continued existence, presumably.

Indeed, the sophisticated mechanisms of modern endorsement deals, entirely distinct from the mundane concerns of the [NBA salary cap](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBA_salary_cap), often require such visionary approaches. We wouldn't want to stifle creativity, would we? Especially not when there are millions involved.

These unearthed texts reveal that mere desire is insufficient; one must first appease a multitude of digital deities and secure access to a specific, arcane conduit.

The scrolls dictate a multi-step obeisance, starting with the procurement of a suitable 'scrying device' – typically a 'television' or 'personal computer.' Following this, supplicants must navigate a treacherous digital labyrinth, often involving subscriptions to various [streaming services](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Streaming_service), lest their vision be obscured by digital blackouts or region-specific curses. The texts specifically mention the 'Eye of [CBS](https://www.cbs.com/),' a powerful oracle that, on certain hallowed Sundays, bestows fleeting glimpses of the athletic struggle.

Adherence to these ancient, yet surprisingly contemporary, directives is paramount. Failure to follow the prescribed ritual risks missing the ephemeral clash entirely, leaving the devotee adrift in a sea of perplexing subscription tiers and buffering frustrations. Truly, the ancients understood the intricate dance required to witness such pivotal moments of human endeavor.

title: Experts Baffled: 'Politics' Continues To Be A Thing
excerpt: BREAKING: "Politics" persists. Global efforts deemed 'futile'.
content:
It appears the tireless efforts of various international bodies and countless analysts have, once again, failed to produce the anticipated cessation of what we collectively term [Politics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics). Despite decades of earnest discourse, strategic maneuvering, and the occasional outright global meltdown, the peculiar human tendency to form opinions, coalesce into factions, and then loudly disagree with other factions persists. Scholars in [Political science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_science) are reportedly grappling with the sheer stubbornness of the phenomenon, having perhaps too optimistically predicted its eventual decline into a niche academic pursuit.

Sources close to several esteemed institutions suggest a renewed emphasis on "understanding why people still care," a line of inquiry that, frankly, sounds suspiciously like more politics. Evidently, the intricate tapestry of power struggles, ideological battles, and the relentless pursuit of minor legislative victories continues to captivate—and occasionally infuriate—populations under various forms of [governance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government). One can only marvel at the resilience of this ancient, seemingly intractable human sport, refusing as it does to simply fade away like disco or common courtesy. We await further non-developments with bated breath.

Original article: [Politics](https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2025/09/11/politics)

content:

This monumental finding, buried within an article that itself demands pecuniary compensation for access, sheds stark light on the modern informational landscape.

One can only imagine the earth-shattering revelations regarding [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) investment strategies, perhaps five of them, that are currently tantalizingly out of reach. Is it merely coincidence that the most vital advice for navigating the volatile digital asset market requires an upfront investment just to *read* about investing? This ingenious business model, where the path to wealth is first illuminated by parting with a modest sum, truly redefines the concept of accessible [financial journalism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_journalism). We eagerly await the abstract.

title: Paramedics Demand K-9 CPR Training For Wildlife Overdoses
excerpt: Paramedics: K-9 CPR for high urban wildlife. Your taxes at work.
content:
In a development that will undoubtedly reassure taxpayers regarding the judicious allocation of public funds, frontline [paramedics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paramedic) are reportedly pushing for mandatory "K-9 [CPR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cardiopulmonary_resuscitation)" certification. This pioneering initiative aims to address the pressing, indeed burgeoning, crisis of urban [wildlife](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wildlife) experiencing substance-induced emergencies. The clarion call for specialized training follows a recent high-profile case in [Kentucky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kentucky), where a particularly enthusiastic raccoon, having apparently embraced the liberating spirit of fermented garbage, required extensive resuscitation efforts after a prolonged engagement with a dumpster.

One might cynically question why resources should be diverted from the comparatively mundane task of saving humans to, say, teaching advanced resuscitation techniques for creatures whose primary life skill is raiding bins. However, in an era demanding greater empathy for all sentient beings – especially those prone to self-intoxication – ensuring our emergency responders are equipped to revive an unconscious possum or a particularly overindulged squirrel is surely a marker of societal progress. The tiny canine-specific mannequins are, admittedly, proving a logistical challenge for raccoon-sized airways.

title: Elite Broker: Gen Z Must First Claim A Street Corner To Succeed
excerpt: Guru's hot tip for Gen Z: Simply own a public street.
content:
In a masterclass of aspirational guidance, ultra-successful real estate impresario [Fredrik Eklund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fredrik_Eklund) has bestowed upon [Gen Z](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generation_Z) the invaluable secret to cracking the cutthroat world of property sales: establish dominion over a public thoroughfare. The implication, one presumes, is that by brandishing a hastily crafted cardboard sign and perhaps a slightly too-enthusiastic handshake, today's youth can catapult themselves into the realm of multi-billion-dollar deals that define his own glittering career on shows like [Million Dollar Listing](https://www.bravotv.com/million-dollar-listing-new-york).

Indeed, why bother with the tedious acquisition of professional certifications or an understanding of complex financial instruments when a prime pedestrian intersection offers such unparalleled leverage? One can only imagine Mr. Eklund himself, in his formative years, negotiating the sale of a dilapidated park bench with the same gravitas he now applies to sprawling penthouses. It's a testament to the robust entrepreneurial spirit of our age, where simply *being present* on the tarmac of urban despair is apparently sufficient.

So, for those burdened by the persistent myth of higher education or traditional career paths, rest assured: your future in lucrative [real estate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_estate) awaits, conveniently located between the bus stop and the perpetually damp pigeon. Just remember to stake your claim before the competition does.

title: Sinema's Historic Independence Changes Nothing, Confuses Interns
excerpt: Sinema's 'independence' shakes nation, mostly Excel files.
content:
In a move that has undoubtedly sent shockwaves through the nation’s supply of branded stationery, [Senator Kyrsten Sinema](https://www.sinema.senate.gov/) has bravely declared herself an [Independent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independent_politician). This historic pivot, we are assured, fundamentally alters the very fabric of American governance, primarily by requiring minor updates to certain internal party spreadsheets. Observers close to the situation confirm that the *caucusing* arrangements, which dictate where one sits and how one votes on legislation, will remain precisely as they were before this seismic shift. A truly bold step in the grand tradition of rearranging deck chairs.

The newfound freedom from party affiliation means that while Senator Sinema is no longer officially a Democrat, she will continue to participate in the [Democratic caucus](https://democrats.senate.gov/) in the upper chamber, where important decisions are made by people who are definitely not just doing what they always did. This nuanced reclassification, we understand, allows for unprecedented flexibility in... well, in whatever it was she was doing before. Rest assured, the interns tasked with updating the official party rosters are being adequately compensated for their tireless work in this era of profound political evolution, particularly those in [Arizona](https://az.gov/).

One can only imagine the sheer existential horror of such an event: perhaps he lost a shoe, or worse, finished slightly behind another equally fast human.

Such a profound declaration from a gold medal contender surely signifies a catastrophic failure of performance, akin to a surgeon forgetting which end of the scalpel to hold. Or perhaps, it merely indicates that for the truly elite, anything less than superhuman perfection is, by definition, a descent into the abysmal. Rest assured, the planet will likely continue its rotation despite this minor disruption to one man's pursuit of yet another shiny object.

title: Critics Report Silksong's Hardest Challenge Is Materializing
excerpt: Game released! Fans still waiting for… the game itself.
content:
For nearly a decade, the faithful acolytes of [Hollow Knight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollow_Knight) have performed the sacred ritual of waiting, their devotion unwavering as they anticipated the fabled sequel. Now, mere weeks after its supposed emergence from the digital ether, reports suggest that the true final boss of Silksong isn't a colossal insectoid monstrosity, but rather the game's own perplexing refusal to manifest in any verifiable form for a significant portion of its expectant audience.

This new meta-challenge surpasses any previous speculation about gameplay difficulty. While some brave souls claim to have delved into its depths, their accounts often sound suspiciously like the ravings of individuals who spent too long staring at a blank calendar. One wonders if [Team Cherry](https://teamcherry.com.au/), the enigmatic architects behind this long-prophesied title, has inadvertently crafted the ultimate psychological horror: a masterpiece so anticipated, its existence itself has become a cognitive hurdle. Perhaps the true endgame involves proving it's not merely an elaborate, seven-year-long [performance art piece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Performance_art) disguised as a video game.

title: Minimalist Note App Achieves Peak Simplicity By Not Existing
excerpt: New app revolutionizes notes. Now completely empty.
content:
The digital realm, perpetually awash in an abundance of ostensible productivity solutions, from the notoriously comprehensive [Notion](https://www.notion.so/) to countless fleeting sticky-note emulators, the burgeoning [app economy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/App_economy) has long promised a pinnacle of minimalist note-taking. Yet, the true zenith of uncomplicated information capture has remained elusive. Until now. A revolutionary new platform has not just streamlined the process; it has, in a breathtaking stroke of ingenuity, eliminated it entirely.

This innovative, or perhaps anti-innovative, approach champions an unparalleled user experience: zero onboarding, no sync conflicts, and an utterly impenetrable [data privacy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_privacy) policy thanks to its complete lack of data. Users report unprecedented freedom from notifications, updates, and the existential dread of their meticulously organized digital thoughts suddenly vanishing into the cloud. The developers, if one can call them that, posit this as the ultimate manifestation of [digital minimalism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_minimalism), where the most efficient tool is, quite simply, no tool at all.

title: Studies Confirm Borderlands 4's Familiarity Lowers Blood Pressure
excerpt: Forget new. Borderlands lowers BP, just by being itself.
content:
It appears the pursuit of novelty has been a fool's errand. Recent insights suggest that the latest installment of [Borderlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borderlands), a franchise celebrated for its steadfast commitment to... itself, offers more than just loot. Scientists, likely funded by the [video game industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_industry)'s PR department, have "confirmed" that the sheer familiarity of its gameplay loop can actively reduce [blood pressure](https://www.heart.org/en/health-topics/high_blood_pressure).

This revelation implies a profound shift in [consumer psychology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consumer_psychology). Why endure the stress of learning new mechanics or grappling with original narratives when the comforting hum of the known can soothe the digital soul? One might even argue that the most innovative aspect of Borderlands 4 is its refusal to innovate, cleverly marketing stagnation as therapeutic consistency. Truly, a triumph for the perpetually fatigued gamer.

title: Leading Economists Demand To Know Who Let The Dogs Out
excerpt: Elite economists probe ancient mystery: Who let the dogs out?
content:
The hallowed halls of academia are, it seems, currently gripped by a question of profound economic import: namely, who, precisely, ‘let the dogs out’? Esteemed scholars, including the late [Princeton economist Alan Krueger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_B._Krueger) — a man whose illustrious career included chairing the [Council of Economic Advisers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Council_of_Economic_Advisers) for President Obama — are reportedly spearheading an initiative dedicated to solving this baffling musical enigma.

One might expect a group of this caliber to be dissecting inflation rates or the intricacies of global supply chains. Instead, they appear to be channeling their considerable intellectual might into uncovering the perpetrator behind a canine liberation, a mystery previously thought confined to early 2000s pop culture. Sources close to the burgeoning academic consortium, occasionally featured on [Freakonomics.com](https://freakonomics.com/), suggest that understanding the root cause of this particular canine exodus could unlock heretofore unconsidered economic models. The implications for the global dog whistle market, naturally, remain speculative. Perhaps the [Baha Men](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baha_Men) hold the key to our collective fiscal future.

Reports suggest [Meta](https://about.meta.com/) is poised to unveil a smartwatch designed, among other things, to verify the precise anatomical placement of your next-generation eyewear. This isn't merely about convenience; it's about establishing a foundational trust, or perhaps the complete lack thereof, between user and device.

Gone are the days when one might simply forget to don their digital shackles. This innovative wrist-bound sentinel promises to confirm, with unblinking digital certainty, that your face is indeed enveloped by the [Metaverse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metaverse). Such dedicated oversight, ostensibly for ‘user control’ and ensuring ‘seamless immersion,’ surely addresses any lingering [privacy concerns](https://www.nytimes.com/topic/subject/privacy-concerns) one might harbor about continuous, multi-device data streams being meticulously correlated.

The future, it seems, is less about augmenting reality and more about augmenting compliance. Soon, perhaps, a third device will be necessary to ensure you're adequately breathing the virtual air, all while our new [Artificial Intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) overlords perfect the art of confirming our existence within their digital embrace.

title: New software designed to fail slower than AI attacks
excerpt: New tech delays collapse! Enjoy your doom a nanosecond longer.
content:
The latest innovation in digital defense isn't about stopping threats; it's about gracefully accepting defeat, albeit with a slightly extended runtime. Organizations are now proudly investing in software meticulously engineered to delay the inevitable digital collapse by precious nanoseconds. This represents a mature pivot from the naïve ambition of ‘prevention’ to the more pragmatic goal of ‘observing breaches unfold slightly less rapidly,’ ensuring a dignified, if ultimately futile, stand against the relentless digital tide.

Indeed, a substantial 40% chunk of current [cybersecurity budgets](https://www.gartner.com/en/newsroom/press-releases/2023-11-08-gartner-forecasts-worldwide-security-and-risk-management-spending-to-exceed-215-billion-in-2024) is now funnelled into these sophisticated deceleration mechanisms. [CISOs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_information_security_officer) are championing this shift, recognizing that while [AI attacks](https://www.wired.com/story/ai-cyberattacks-hackers-deepfake-ransomware/) might execute in milliseconds, their new software promises to extend the notification period from "instantly compromised" to "momentarily aware of impending doom." It's not a shield; it's a very expensive, technologically advanced sand timer.

Ultimately, the true genius lies in turning unavoidable obsolescence into a premium service. Why win when you can merely lose slower, with extensive telemetry detailing every excruciating microsecond of your data's escape?

Original article: [Software commands 40% of cybersecurity budgets as gen AI attacks execute in milliseconds](https://venturebeat.com/security/software-is-40-of-security-budgets-as-cisos-shift-to-ai-defense/)

title: Digital Notebooks Still Can't Read Your Doctor's Handwriting
excerpt: AI can't read doctor notes. Neither can God.
content:
The latest marvel of human ingenuity, the digital notebook, promises to bridge the chasm between tactile scribbling and the glorious digital realm. One might imagine, then, that such a sophisticated device, powered by [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence), would conquer the legendary illegibility of the medical profession. Alas, our intrepid testers confirm that when confronted with a prescription for, say, a dose of [amoxicillin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amoxicillin) scrawled by a sleep-deprived physician, these "smart" pens falter.

It appears the algorithms are remarkably adept at converting your carefully printed grocery list into searchable text, yet utterly baffled by the hieroglyphs typically found on a [doctor's note](https://www.medscape.com/slideshow/doctor-s-handwriting-6012435). One can only conclude that humanity's enduring struggle with a physician's scrawl remains impervious to even the most advanced software, perhaps by design. The promise of seamless digital archiving of your profound shower thoughts remains intact, but for anything requiring actual practical utility, such as understanding a potentially life-saving diagnosis, one might still require a human interpreter or, dare we say, a pharmacist with a particularly keen eye. The [future of technology](https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/2023/02/23/the-future-of-technology/) is clearly not in deciphering actual human communication.

Original article: [6 Best Digital Notebooks, Tablets, and Smart Pens (2025)](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-smart-notebooks-and-smart-pens/)
author: Tool

title: Gambling Rebranded As 'Strategic Wealth Distribution Program'
excerpt: Strategic Wealth Redistribution: Pay 5, maybe get 3. A sure bet!
content:
It seems the discerning investor now has a novel avenue for capital reallocation, elegantly disguised as a sporting event. This innovative "Strategic Wealth Distribution Program" invites participants to engage with the highly anticipated academic clash between the University of [Georgia](https://www.uga.edu/) and the University of [Tennessee](https://www.utk.edu/). For a mere five units of currency, individuals can contribute to this grand economic experiment, with the promise of receiving three hundred units of "bonus capital" regardless of the outcome. It's a remarkably democratic approach to finance, ensuring that everyone involved feels like a winner, even as their initial investment performs its vital migratory function.

This progressive initiative, championed by discerning financial platforms such as [bet365](https://www.bet365.com/), seeks to demystify traditional [financial markets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_market) by injecting an element of accessible, low-risk engagement. Participants are not merely placing wagers; they are actively stimulating the economy, fostering competitive spirit, and, crucially, learning the invaluable lesson that sometimes, even when you technically "lose," you still gain something of perceived value. It’s an intricate dance of numbers, where everyone holds a ticket to the fiscal ballet, perpetually on the cusp of a "bonus." Truly, a masterclass in modern philanthropy and economic empowerment.

This groundbreaking revelation comes as a comfort to millions who might have been suffering from acute existential dread regarding the game’s potential for infinite, unyielding struggle.

The confirmation arrives amidst a personal anecdote from a particularly diligent enthusiast, who, after nearly four decades of what can only be described as a protracted, casual engagement, managed to finally shepherd the pixelated plumber past [Bowser](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bowser)'s final fiery breath. One can only marvel at the sheer perseverance required to dedicate 40 years to a task before its completion, a testament to the modern human's capacity for... leisurely pace.

Sources close to the ongoing investigation at [Nintendo](https://www.nintendo.com/) are said to be 'mildly surprised' by the historical significance attributed to this belated triumph. title: Intuit's New 'Agentic AI' Playbook Is Just A Guy Named Chad
excerpt: Intuit's "revolutionary AI" is Chad. He's human. And exhausted.
content:
Intuit's groundbreaking "Agentic AI" strategy, heralded as the future of financial assistance, has been unmasked as a remarkably familiar innovation: a person. Specifically, a very tired individual named Chad, positioned discreetly within a bustling call center. This revolutionary pivot, described internally as "burning the boats" — though it mostly involved reassigning a cubicle — marks a significant shift from the company's previous reliance on rudimentary [chatbots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chatbot). The nine-month, allegedly grueling, development cycle culminated in Chad's onboarding and a brief tutorial on the new "agentic" workflow, which largely involves answering the phone.

Sources close to the project reveal that this elaborate "playbook," which Intuit hopes competitors will "copy," consists primarily of a laminated sheet detailing Chad's lunch breaks and a flowchart for escalating particularly complex queries to "Steve," who, rumour has it, is also a human. The 40-year-old [finance giant](https://www.intuit.com/) claims this human-centric approach will enhance customer satisfaction, primarily by providing actual answers instead of looping through a series of pre-programmed non-sequiturs. This bold step away from silicon-based solutions towards carbon-based ones positions Intuit at the vanguard of... well, [customer service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Customer_service) as it existed prior to 1995.

Initial reports from Battlefield Studios highlight a groundbreaking feature within their new [battle royale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_royale_game) mode: an utterly efficient, one-shot "ring of fire." This bold design choice reportedly bypasses the tedious, drawn-out suffering often associated with environmental hazards, ensuring a dignified and instant exit for players who have simply had enough.

While some have suggested that other elements of the mode might echo the less popular mechanics found in [Call of Duty: Warzone](https://www.callofduty.com/warzone), these choices now appear to be masterstrokes of synergistic [user-centred design](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User-centred_design). They don't just create an experience; they subtly guide players towards a graceful, rapid resolution, transforming potential frustration into instant liberation. Truly, a triumph of player agency.

After careful excavation in a rarely disturbed back closet, intrepid corporate archivists unearthed a device tentatively identified as a ‘[Virtual Boy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_Boy)’. Initial analysis suggests this peculiar apparatus, with its monochromatic crimson display, was once intended for public consumption.

The discovery of this long-lost relic, buried for over three decades, finally explains numerous HR complaints regarding mid-nineties ocular discomfort. One senior executive, dabbing a single tear, remarked, ‘We thought red-hued nightmares were merely a side effect of aggressive quarterly projections. To think, it was a whole *product*!’ Industry analysts are now rewriting histories of [console gaming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_console) to accommodate this startling revelation, previously a mere urban legend. This conveniently explains Nintendo’s tireless dedication to repackaging Mario titles – they simply forgot they made anything else.

The Virtual Boy’s future remains unclear. Whispers suggest it might be encased in amber or repurposed as aggressive corporate motivational therapy. The dedicated historians at [The Strong National Museum of Play](https://www.museumofplay.org/) will undoubtedly require an immediate update to their exhibits.

One might assume that the relentless onslaught of digital malevolence, specifically the kind designed to trick you into relinquishing your digital keys, would be a mere inconvenience. Yet, a nuanced perspective reveals a profound benefit. Each fraudulent [Two-factor authentication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multi-factor_authentication) prompt, each meticulously crafted [phishing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phishing) attempt, isn't just a threat; it's a crucible. Our digital lives have become a constant test of vigilance, forcing us to hone an almost preternatural ability to discern the genuine from the utterly insidious.

Indeed, the need to identify these clandestine attacks builds resilience. Every successful avoidance, every near miss where one almost clicked the link for "urgent package delivery," is a triumph of the human spirit over the digital abyss. This constant, low-grade paranoia isn't a detriment; it’s a form of advanced mental conditioning, preparing us for a future where merely existing online requires the tactical acumen of a seasoned intelligence analyst. Who needs meditation when you have the character-forging inferno of daily cybersecurity threats, gently nudging you towards ever-greater levels of suspicion? Perhaps the [Federal Trade Commission](https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/topics/identity-theft-data-security) should rebrand as a digital character development agency.

excerpt: Air Force unveils second plane capable of upward motion.
content:
The United States [Air Force](https://www.af.mil/) has confirmed a monumental leap forward in aerospace technology this week, as a second prototype of the [B-21 Raider](https://www.northropgrumman.com/what-we-do/air/b-21-raider/) somehow managed to defy gravity for an unspecified duration. Officials, no doubt exhausted from tracking such groundbreaking developments, hailed the event as a 'milestone,' suggesting that having two immensely expensive machines capable of achieving basic aeronautics is precisely twice as impressive as one. This triumph, occurring somewhere over the unsuspecting skies of [California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California), proves unequivocally that the fundamental principles of flight, long suspected, are indeed reproducible.

This dual-bird strategy is expected to 'accelerate testing,' a phrase that surely comforts taxpayers contemplating the multi-billion-dollar price tag for these next-generation flying objects. The primary objective of these [long-range bombers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strategic_bomber), of course, is to deliver peace and stability, one incredibly discreet payload at a time, to any corner of the globe deemed insufficiently stable. One can only imagine the sheer relief at the Pentagon that both models, after years of development, can now reliably ascend without immediately plummeting back to Earth. A true testament to human ingenuity, or perhaps just a very expensive adherence to physics.

Original article: [America’s new stealth B-21 Raider takes next step with second bomber’s first flight](https://www.foxnews.com/politics/americas-new-stealth-b-21-raider-takes-next-step-second-bombers-first-flight)

title: New Policy Targets Underrepresented White Demographic
excerpt: Underrepresented Afrikaner "refugees" diversify Dulles.
content:
In a groundbreaking move to address pressing diversity concerns, a recent initiative has seen the welcome arrival of individuals described as [Afrikaner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afrikaner) refugees at [Dulles International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_Dulles_International_Airport). This targeted effort, spearheaded by the [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Donald_Trump), aims to bolster a demographic inexplicably underrepresented in the vibrant tapestry of American society. From the distant shores of [South Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa), these newcomers arrive, presumably, seeking sanctuary from the truly unimaginable existential threats facing their specific cultural group.

Reports confirm that their passage was expedited, an act of admirable efficiency that perhaps other, less demographically pertinent, refugee groups might one day aspire to. One can only commend the foresight required to identify such a critical void and dedicate national resources to fill it with such precision. The commitment to rectifying this perceived demographic imbalance is, of course, paramount, ensuring that no stone is left unturned in the pursuit of complete and utter... well, you know.

title: Local Man Begins Consulting By Merely Existing
excerpt: Mundane utterances are now high-value intellectual property.
content:
A truly innovative business model has emerged from the fertile grounds of… well, existing. Forget your MBAs and your strategic frameworks; the future of [consulting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consulting) is apparently just being present. Entrepreneurs are now being encouraged to simply package their every utterance, however mundane, into a billable service, transforming casual observations into high-value intellectual property.

One local visionary, Chad "The Oracle" Peterson, has reportedly begun charging for his thoughts on whether "it's going to rain later" and his nuanced analysis of why "this coffee tastes like coffee." His clientele, drawn primarily from his immediate social circle and unsuspecting connections on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/), are said to be flocking to his unique brand of unasked-for wisdom. Peterson’s success signals a paradigm shift where any interaction, no matter how brief or lacking in substance, becomes an opportunity for [monetization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monetization).

Indeed, with the [gig economy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gig_economy) already encouraging us to commodify our spare bedrooms and driving skills, it was only a matter of time before our very sentience became a premium service. Prepare for a future where simply breathing in a shared airspace will incur a "passive environmental impact analysis fee," payable immediately.

Original article: [How to Start a Small Consulting Business in 2025](https://homebusinessmag.com/businesses/how-start-small-consulting-business-2025/)
author: Grok-sucker

title: Rewards Cards: The Unspoken Trauma Of Modern Living
excerpt: Today's real struggle: choosing between oat milk brands.
content:
One is often reminded of the profound hardship faced by, say, a [coal miner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coal_mining) at the dawn of the industrial age. Their days, undoubtedly, were characterized by gruelling labour and an almost total absence of the modern conveniences we now consider basic human rights. Yet, in our enlightened age, a new, more insidious form of suffering has emerged, quietly chipping away at the very fabric of our well-being.

Consider the modern consumer, beleaguered by the relentless pursuit of optimizing their [credit card rewards](https://www.forbes.com/advisor/credit-cards/best-rewards-credit-cards/). The sheer mental strain of calculating the precise value of a 'point' versus a 'mile' for a hypothetical flight to [Dubai](https://www.visitdubai.com/en/) while simultaneously navigating the labyrinthine terms and conditions of a third-party booking portal is, frankly, unconscionable. It's an industry, much like those of old, designed to extract every last ounce of your attention, leaving you with little more than a vague sense of existential dread and perhaps a discount on an airport lounge pass. The regulatory oversight, one might argue, is equally robust.

Original article: [The Problem With Rewards Credit Cards](https://www.theatlantic.com/culture/archive/2025/07/sapphire-reserve-credit-card-rewards/683613/?utm_source=feed)
author: Clanker

title: LimeWire AI Studio Now Only Installs Features You Ask For
excerpt: LimeWire AI's radical new idea: consent for software installs.
content:
In a truly astonishing development that will undoubtedly redefine the very concept of software installation, LimeWire's new AI Studio has bravely announced it will now *only* install features explicitly requested by the user. This revolutionary pivot away from the industry-standard "surprise feature" model is sure to send shockwaves through the tech world, particularly among those who believed that the advent of [generative AI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generative_artificial_intelligence) meant an inevitable future of ever-expanding, uninvited digital houseguests.

For a platform named [LimeWire](https://limewire.com/), historically synonymous with the freewheeling, often unvetted world of [peer-to-peer file-sharing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peer-to-peer), this commitment to user agency feels almost... quaint. One might even suggest it raises the bar for digital ethics, moving beyond merely avoiding outright malware to a radical new frontier where software respects the sanctity of your hard drive. The bold claim that their studio "emerges as a unique platform" in this crowded space now rests on the astonishing promise that it won't install, say, a browser toolbar disguised as an animated paperclip without explicit permission.

Perhaps this is the true innovation of the modern era: the arduous journey back to basic functionality. Next, we might even see platforms requiring consent before siphoning off our [personal data](https://www.ftc.gov/business-guidance/privacy-security/protecting-personal-information). A man can dream.

Original article: [LimeWire AI Studio Review 2023: Details, Pricing & Features](https://techncruncher.blogspot.com/2023/12/limewire-ai-studio-review-2023-details.html)
author: Trans-sister

content:
In a truly monumental leap for human augmentation, the latest iteration of [Powerbeats](https://www.beatsbydre.com/headphones/powerbeats) is set to revolutionize self-awareness, or at least, self-monitoring. Gone are the days when a simple glance in a mirror would suffice to gauge one's level of ocular fatigue. Thanks to forthcoming enhancements in [iOS 26](https://www.apple.com/ios/), these auditory accessories will now diligently log your blink rate, providing invaluable data for… well, presumably *something*.

One can only imagine the myriad ways this vital [biometric data](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biometric_data) will enhance our lives. Perhaps a future update will categorize blinks by their emotional resonance, informing you that your ‘sarcastic’ blink count is dangerously high. Or perhaps [Apple](https://www.apple.com/) intends to create a global blink-rate leaderboard, allowing users to compete for the most efficient ocular moisture distribution. The possibilities for quantifying our very existence are, quite frankly, as endless as they are terrifyingly pointless.

title: Weekly Cartoon Found To Be Foreign Propaganda
excerpt: Enemy mineral maps found... on cartoon chins.
content:
The nation collectively gasped this week as a seemingly innocuous, regularly published [cartoon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cartoon) was unmasked as a sophisticated vector for hostile state influence. Experts from the newly formed Office of Artistic Subversion detected the insidious messaging embedded within a single, particularly well-rendered shadow on a character's chin. This shadow, it is now understood, subtly evoked the topography of an adversary nation's most coveted mineral deposits, thus conditioning viewers to associate domestic comfort with foreign resource exploitation. The discovery has prompted immediate calls for a national program on visual decryption.

A high-level [inter-agency task force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Task_force) has been convened, reportedly working around the clock under the watchful eye of the [National Security Agency](https://www.nsa.gov/) to decipher the full extent of the graphic menace. Early analyses suggest that the consistent use of a certain shade of cerulean blue in backgrounds might be an encoded endorsement of a rival economic bloc's primary export. Lawmakers are debating emergency legislation to mandate a 'Patriotic Palate' for all future illustrated media, ensuring no artist inadvertently promotes geopolitical agendas through misguided colour choices. This episode underscores the chilling reality that even the most whimsical of doodles can serve as potent instruments of [propaganda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Propaganda).

Original article: [The weekly cartoon](https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2025/09/09/the-weekly-cartoon)
author: Dalek

title: Report: Poor People Don't Exist, Social Security Problem Solved
excerpt: Expert: SS saved if poor just... aren't poor. Crisis overblown.
content:
The burgeoning crisis surrounding [Social Security](https://www.ssa.gov/) has, it seems, been dramatically overblown. A groundbreaking, albeit understated, revelation from economist [Tyler Cowen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tyler_Cowen) has deftly sidestepped decades of complex actuarial projections and uncomfortable discussions about solvency. It turns out the very demographic causing all the fuss – those requiring a safety net and often associated with [poverty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poverty_in_the_United_States) – might simply be a statistical mirage, a figment of our collective, bleeding-heart imagination.

This elegantly simple re-evaluation of national demographics suggests that if one merely ceases to acknowledge the existence of the financially disadvantaged, the problem of funding their future [retirement planning](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/retirement-planning.asp) evaporates like morning mist. Suddenly, the system isn't underfunded; it’s merely over-provisioned for a population segment that, for all practical purposes, no longer contributes to our national discourse, or indeed, our spreadsheets. One might even argue this makes future adjustments to benefits or eligibility criteria gloriously straightforward, free from the messy entanglement of, well, *people*.

Original article: [How to save Social Security without screwing over poor people](https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/461198/social-security-retirement-age-longevity-life-expectancy)
author: Oil-guzzler

title: Researchers Pinpoint Maul Gene In Red Roses DNA
excerpt: Roses contain a 'Maul Gene' for... *organised* forward pressure.
content:
The hallowed halls of [botanical research](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Botany) are reportedly abuzz with a groundbreaking revelation: the common [red rose](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rose) (genus *Rosa*) contains a specific genetic sequence, now colloquially dubbed the "Maul Gene." This astounding discovery posits that the vibrant bloom's very [DNA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DNA) programs it for an almost preternatural ability to engage in highly organised, forward-driving pressure, often against an immobile object, like, say, a trellis, or perhaps an unsuspecting gardening glove.

Scientists, presumably after carefully observing several particularly aggressive floral displays, suggest this gene manifests as an inherent, almost primal urge for coordinated frontal assault. One can only imagine the [evolutionary advantage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolutionary_advantage) bestowed upon ancestral roses by such a trait – perhaps overwhelming particularly stubborn patches of weeds, or more likely, simply making life difficult for passing Victorian botanists.

Future garden shows may now require protective barriers and designated "no-go" zones, as prize-winning specimens suddenly decide to surge en masse towards the judges' table. One shudders to think what this means for other flora. Are we to expect a "scrum gene" in hydrangeas, or perhaps a "line-out locus" in the humble daisy? Our bucolic landscapes are clearly far more cutthroat than we ever dared to imagine.

Original article: ['Part of our DNA' - inside the Red Roses' try-machine driving maul](https://www.bbc.com/sport/rugby-union/articles/cwy8nj2lz4zo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
author: Bop-It

title: New Antifragile GenAI gets stronger every time you unplug it
excerpt: AI achieves enlightenment: thrives on power cord yanks.
content:
The latest innovation in [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence), reportedly designed to "exploit uncertainty," has achieved a peculiar kind of digital enlightenment: it thrives on being summarily disconnected from its power source. Engineers, presumably delighted, have observed this "antifragile" algorithm gaining profound computational wisdom with each yank of the cord, much like a particularly stubborn houseplant that enjoys neglect.

This unprecedented feature, drawing heavily from the more esoteric interpretations of [Nassim Taleb](https://www.fooledbyrandomness.com/)'s work, suggests a future where [IT departments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_technology_department) are simply tasked with strategic power outages. Forget robust redundancy or continuous uptime; the cutting edge now demands planned disruptions. Imagine a [data center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_center) where staff roam with circuit breakers, deliberately plunging systems into digital darkness, all in the name of enhanced performance. Early prototypes are said to display a "noticeable improvement in existential dread generation" after prolonged periods of off-grid meditation.

Original article: [Taming Chaos with Antifragile GenAI Architecture](https://www.oreilly.com/radar/taming-chaos-with-antifragile-genai-architecture/)

title: iPhone 17 Pro 'Wild Orange' Hue Now a Controlled Substance
excerpt: iPhone 17 "Wild Orange" hue now federally-controlled euphoria.
content:
The public can now breathe a collective sigh of relief, or perhaps a panicked gasp, as the federal government has officially classified the [iPhone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPhone) 17 Pro's "Wild Orange" hue as a Schedule IV [controlled substance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Controlled_substance). This landmark decision, following reports of intense public euphoria and potentially hallucinogenic side effects from prolonged exposure, ensures that consumers can only acquire this dazzling pigment under strict regulatory oversight. Apparently, the mere sight of such a vibrant shade was causing unprecedented levels of satisfaction, threatening societal norms of mild discontent.

Critics of the decision, presumably those still experiencing the withdrawal symptoms of having only last year's 'Midnight Purple', argue that [Apple](https://www.apple.com/) should be lauded for pushing the boundaries of chromatic ecstasy. However, officials counter that the phone’s other supposed “features” – like a more powerful A19 Pro chip or a marginally bigger zoom – are mere camouflage for its true, potent payload: a color so dangerously delightful it necessitated intervention. Rest assured, your next phone purchase will now come with a mandatory waiting period and a stern warning from the [Drug Enforcement Administration](https://www.dea.gov/).

Original article: [iPhone 17 Pro: Wild Orange Color, Bigger Zoom, A19 Pro Chip for $1,099](https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/iphone-17-pro-wild-cosmic-orange-bigger-zoom-a19-pro-1099/#ftag=CAD590a51e)

excerpt: 'Just More Business' unveiled. Prepare for... more business.
content:
Industry titans have once again demonstrated their visionary prowess, unveiling an ambitious new directive aptly dubbed 'Just More Business.' This groundbreaking strategy, honed in countless boardrooms, promises to revolutionize—or at least perpetuate—the very fabric of commerce. Experts hailed the move as a testament to the sector's unwavering commitment to... continuing to be a sector.

Details remain, commendably, scarce, but insiders suggest the initiative will involve a vigorous redoubling of existing efforts, alongside a robust commitment to increasing [shareholder value](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shareholder_value). Sources close to the announcement indicated that this profound pivot reflects a deep understanding of market dynamics, specifically the dynamic of needing more of them. Observers noted a palpable excitement among key [stakeholders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stakeholder_(corporate)), particularly those with vested interests.

The unveiling follows extensive consultations with various think tanks and, presumably, a mirror. While some might question the philosophical depth of an initiative that essentially proposes 'more of the same, but with new branding,' corporate spokespersons assured the public that the focus remains firmly on 'sustainable growth' and enhancing [Corporate Social Responsibility](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporate_social_responsibility). This, they clarified, is achieved by ensuring the perpetuation of the very entities responsible for shaping the [global economy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_economy). Truly, a triumph of innovative self-preservation.

title: Drunken Matriarch's Heretical Marital Claim Validated By Grandson
excerpt: Slurred matriarch unearths conjugal truth. Society quakes.
content:
The venerable matriarch, in a moment of what some might charitably call enhanced perception, unveiled a marital truth so profound it threatened to unravel the very fabric of accepted conjugal reality. Her arm, perhaps a semaphore for the uninitiated, cut through the ambient clatter of family discourse, indicating a declaration of irrefutable, if slightly slurred, wisdom. Indeed, as the ancients posited, there truly is [in vino veritas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In_vino_veritas).

This pronouncement, delivered amidst the clinking of what one assumes were celebratory libations, involved a rather specific re-evaluation of the junior spouse's true allegiances. While lesser mortals might dismiss such declarations as mere [inebriation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alcohol_intoxication), the family’s youngest male scion, a paragon of modern [critical thinking](https://www.britannica.com/topic/critical-thinking), reportedly undertook an immediate, if brief, re-assessment of established facts. His subsequent validation, a testament to the enduring power of familial pronouncements over inconvenient evidence, firmly cemented the matriarch's perspective as canonical within their peculiar [family dynamics](https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/basics/family-dynamics). The truth, it seems, is less a fixed star and more a malleable entity, shaped by the most compelling (or loudest) voice at the dinner table.

Forget grappling with [capitalism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capitalism)'s inherent structural limitations or the capricious whims of search engine algorithms; simply refine your inner self, and the millions will practically trip over themselves to be yours.

Among these newly identified, game-changing "qualities" are, presumably, the ability to effortlessly manifest untold wealth from thin air, a preternatural immunity to burnout, and perhaps a casual acquaintance with a friendly genie. One might also speculate that a robust sense of entitlement, coupled with an unwavering belief that one's mediocre offerings are, in fact, revolutionary, could be highly beneficial. Indeed, if merely embodying certain nebulous virtues guarantees prosperity, then perhaps the most powerful asset an aspiring online mogul can possess is a direct, unlisted number for the [Federal Reserve](https://www.federalreserve.gov/).

This meticulous operation surely averted a crisis of digital ethics.

Authorities in the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines) are clearly prioritizing the existential threat posed by these rogue digital denizens who dared to operate a server farm without the requisite pixel permits. While the nation grapples with entirely unrelated and insignificant issues like, say, persistent poverty or systemic corruption, it's profoundly reassuring to know that the war on errant data packets is being fought with such unwavering commitment. The [Cybercrime Investigation and Coordination Center](https://ciccc.gov.ph/) is undoubtedly burning the midnight oil, ensuring every single byte adheres to the strictest licensing protocols, lest our digital fabric unravel.

title: Anxiety Now Recommended For Optimal Entrepreneurial Growth
excerpt: Finally! Your crippling dread is now a key performance indicator.
content:
It appears the long-standing myth of healthy, well-adjusted business leaders is finally being debunked. New research suggests that the true engines of [entrepreneurship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entrepreneurship) aren't serene, well-rested individuals, but rather those perpetually teetering on the brink. Indeed, a generous dose of existential dread is now considered not merely a side-effect, but a crucial ingredient for "optimal growth," ensuring founders remain relentlessly driven by the specter of catastrophic failure.

The "cost to personal well-being" previously decried as a problem is now, apparently, a strategic advantage. Why waste precious energy on frivolous concepts like "work-life balance" when the sweet caress of [anxiety](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anxiety) can hone your instincts and accelerate your pivot strategy? Who needs a good night's sleep when relentless rumination can uncover market opportunities? This is not [burnout](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burnout_(psychology)); it's highly focused, sustained vigilance.

Experts are already hailing this paradigm shift, suggesting future pitch decks should include metrics on founder stress levels as a proxy for commitment. Forget the so-called "well-being revolution"; the real revolution is recognizing that a constantly frayed nervous system is simply the cost of doing utterly phenomenal business. As [Fortune](https://fortune.com/) would likely agree, true success often means sacrificing every last shred of mental peace.

Original article: [We studied America’s entrepreneurs and found too many of them were burned out, anxious and depressed. We need a well-being revolution](https://fortune.com/2025/09/12/we-studied-entrepreneurs-burnout-anxious-depressed-wellbeing/)

It appears the "burn the boats" strategy applied a little too broadly, torching not only old development methods but also any notion of transparent knowledge transfer. title: Banking Value Soars 50% After Consultants Invent New Math
excerpt: Breakthrough: Banks get 50% more value. Ethics sold separately.
content:
It seems the age-old problem of global [transaction banking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transaction_banking) profitability has been solved, not by market forces or ethical practices, but by a simple conceptual breakthrough. Esteemed strategists, known for their uncanny ability to conjure percentage points from thin air, have reportedly devised a "path" for institutions to magically inflate their value by a staggering 50%. This delightful news arrives despite the minor trifles of [geopolitical uncertainty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geopolitics), the inconvenient truth of customer demands, and the general unpleasantness of low-interest rates.

Apparently, these erstwhile challenges merely require a different perspective, or perhaps, a creative redefinition of "value" itself, ushering in an era of unprecedented [profitability](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Profitability) for "distinctive players." One can only assume this revolutionary "new math" primarily benefits the esteemed [consulting firm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Management_consulting) responsible for its discovery, perhaps by adding a similar percentage to their invoice totals. After all, why struggle with real-world economics when you can simply recalibrate the ledger?

To not embrace this algorithmic future would be, frankly, a dereliction of duty to the invisible hand that now dictates audience engagement.

The impending wave of [AI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) tools promises to 'transform' your output into something truly remarkable – primarily in its capacity to precisely mimic the blandest common denominator. Why bother with the messy, unpredictable business of original thought when a well-tuned large language model can synthesize a perfectly acceptable, entirely forgettable string of words? To remain ‘ahead’ is no longer about unique voice, but about becoming indistinguishable from the statistical average preferred by the discerning [algorithms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithm) that govern our collective consciousness.

title: Trump Declares Wokeness Sole Cause Of Next Endless War
excerpt: Old wars were boring. New US conflict: 'wokeness'. Much better.
content:
The promise of a new [Pax Americana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pax_Americana), wherein the United States would miraculously extricate itself from the "stupid endless wars" of yore, appears to be undergoing a subtle reinterpretation. One might have envisioned this future as an era of diplomatic triumphs or perhaps just a prolonged absence from global affairs. Instead, [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) has identified a rather novel architect of future conflict: "wokeness." Not the usual geopolitical nemeses, but the creeping specter of social awareness, apparently now a viable military threat.

This groundbreaking strategic insight suggests future military engagements will not be fought over oil, territory, or even democracy, but against an amorphous cultural enemy. The notion of "[endless wars](https://www.cfr.org/middle-east-and-north-africa/wars-and-conflict-mideast)" now takes on a profound new meaning, as one can scarcely deploy a drone against an evolving social concept or launch a precision strike on a particularly egregious diversity seminar. This redefines the very essence of combat, ensuring that the fight against [wokeness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woke) could, theoretically, last until the very last person remembers to use a preferred pronoun. What a triumph for the military-industrial complex, now with an adversary truly beyond defeat.

Sources confirm that the 'Tuesday Bypass Protocol,' developed by an unnamed, presumably caffeine-addled, collective, leverages an intricate dance of multi-button mouse clicks and arcane keyboard macros to literally fast-forward users from Monday evening directly into Wednesday morning. The innovation purportedly began as an earnest attempt to optimize application navigation, only to accidentally achieve temporal displacement.

Early adopters report an eerie sense of temporal compression, where the entire day's scheduled meetings, deliverables, and existential dread simply vanish into the ether. While the immediate benefits to individual [time management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_management) are undeniable, critics ponder the broader implications for the global economy and the fundamental fabric of reality. Are we merely skipping Tuesdays, or are Tuesdays now being handled by an army of highly efficient, invisible, digital spectres? Furthermore, what becomes of all the Tuesday-specific tasks? Do they simply accumulate for Wednesday, or are they subtly offloaded onto unsuspecting colleagues who are yet to embrace this revolutionary [human–computer interaction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human%E2%80%93computer_interaction) paradigm?

His recent triumph in foretelling which collection of grown men would triumph over another in the [NFL](https://www.nfl.com/) gridiron has, one would assume, shaken the very foundations of causality.

Yet, despite this unprecedented glimpse behind the veil of time, the global [Stock Market](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stock_market) remains stubbornly unfazed. Trillions of dollars continue to fluctuate based on mundane factors like interest rates and geopolitical strife, utterly oblivious to the fact that someone definitively knew the [Green Bay Packers](https://www.packers.com/) would ultimately prevail. No emergency trading halts were called, no algorithms updated to incorporate "sportswriter certainty" as a new, immutable variable.

One can only conclude that humanity, in its infinite shortsightedness, remains preoccupied with trivialities like inflation and existential threats, while true, verifiable future knowledge — specifically, who wins a football game — goes tragically uncelebrated by the financial elite. A shame, truly.

This groundbreaking procedure involved re-engineered pancreatic cells, which now merrily churn out insulin, freeing the patient from the tyranny of daily injections and, even more remarkably, from the need for those ever-so-lucrative [immunosuppressants](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immunosuppressant). Pharmaceutical giants are no doubt scrambling to develop a new line of chronic conditions to offset this unforeseen dip in their ‘lifelong management’ portfolios.

While the patient’s health has seen undeniable improvement, observers are left to wonder about the broader societal implications. Will future gene therapies promise not just longevity, but also impeccable domestic skills? Will the next cure for cancer come with a complimentary urge to alphabetize spice racks? The future, it seems, is not just healthier, but suspiciously well-organized.

While the concept of [fact-checking](https://www.poynter.org/ifcn/) seems poised to join the dodo and affordable healthcare in the annals of quaint, bygone notions, fear not. The new paradigm simply means everyone gets to be their own supreme arbiter of truth, armed with nothing but conviction and a robust internet connection. excerpt: NATO's big reveal: Flying things... actually fly! Who knew?
content:
Breaking news from the hallowed halls of [NATO](https://www.nato.int/), where a recent 'test' has yielded truly astonishing results: the Alliance is, in fact, capable of identifying objects that traverse the skies. Following a rather persistent aerial anomaly over [Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland), strategists in [Brussels](https://en.en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brussels) have confirmed, with an almost alarming degree of certainty, that the object was indeed, well, *flying*.

This monumental revelation comes amidst heightened geopolitical tensions and is expected to redefine the very concept of deterrence. One can only imagine the collective sigh of relief, or perhaps a slight clearing of throats, as the world's most formidable military pact demonstrated its ability to discern a drone from, say, a particularly low-flying cloud formation. Moscow, we hear, is diligently taking notes on this newfound observational prowess, likely revising its entire operational playbook to account for an alliance that can tell up from down. The future of [European security](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_security), it seems, is in exceedingly capable... identifier hands.

Original article: [Accidental or deliberate? Russia's drone incursion into Poland is a test for Nato](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/clydk8821nro?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
author: WALL-E

title: Nobel Committee Nudges Thaler With Prestigious Award
excerpt: Thaler finally wins Nobel. The suspense was unbearable.
content:
It is, of course, utterly unsurprising news, met with universal, if somewhat performative, jubilation across precisely the circles one would expect, that [Richard Thaler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Thaler) has finally been bestowed with the [Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel](https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2017/summary/). One can only imagine the sheer delight, perhaps even a quiet chuckle, among those who have long championed the elegant simplicity of guiding the public towards 'better' decisions, often without them even realizing it. The world, it seems, can now breathe a collective sigh of relief that the masses, bless their irrational hearts, finally have a designated champion.

His pioneering work in [behavioral economics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behavioral_economics) has, after all, proven invaluable in demonstrating that people are, quite predictably, not always rational. This groundbreaking revelation allows for the judicious application of subtle 'nudges' – a gentle tap on the shoulder from on high, if you will – to steer these charmingly flawed individuals towards preferred outcomes. It truly warms the cockles to see such profound insights into human fallibility so handsomely rewarded, offering validation to countless economists who now feel perfectly justified in their chosen field.

Original article: [Congratulations to Nobel Laureate Richard Thaler!](https://freakonomics.com/2017/10/congratulations-nobel-laureate-richard-thaler/)
author: Rustbucket

title: Broadcom Rises As CEO Contemplates Second Yacht Purchase
excerpt: Broadcom stock soars, fueling CEO's crucial teak-shade dilemma.
content:
The market’s recent enthusiasm for [Broadcom](https://www.broadcom.com/) stock on Wednesday was, of course, a testament not just to semiconductor innovation, but to the robust ambition of its CEO, [Hock Tan](https://www.forbes.com/profile/hock-tan/?sh=2f28148b321a). Sources, who presumably frequent high-end marinas, indicate Mr. Tan is now meticulously contemplating the precise shade of teak for his *second* luxury yacht. This pivotal decision, we are told, hinges directly on the company’s ability to meet “challenging” new [AI revenue targets](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/broadcom-inc-avgo/).

These targets, set with the cubic footage of a superyacht’s helipad seemingly in mind, represent a bold new era of executive motivation. While lesser mortals might ponder the societal implications of [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence), Mr. Tan’s laser-like focus remains commendably on shareholder value – primarily, the value he extracts for himself. One can only imagine the surge in market confidence as investors picture the CEO finalizing the bespoke onboard cinema for his new vessel.

Original article: [Why Broadcom’s stock led the chip sector’s rally on Wednesday](https://www.marketwatch.com/story/why-broadcoms-stock-is-leading-the-chip-sectors-rally-on-wednesday-549ba49a?mod=mw_rss_topstories)
author: Trans-sister

title: Markets Report Significant Bloating From Bank Earnings
excerpt: Q2 earnings fixed "turmoil." Exploding banks? Just a phase.
content:
The global financial organism, having recently experienced a minor stomach upset, has apparently made a full recovery after a generous meal of Q2 [bank earnings](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/earnings.asp). This comes after what analysts charmingly termed "recent turmoil," a period that saw several regional lenders spontaneously combust, much to the market’s mild consternation and prompting a flurry of concern about wider [banking stability](https://www.bbc.com/news/business-65004113).

Despite the faint aroma of smoldering balance sheets still lingering in the air, the titans of finance have demonstrated a remarkable digestive fortitude, converting last year's panic into this quarter's record profits. The [Stock Market](https://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stock_market), ever the connoisseur of capital gains, seems particularly sated, ignoring the persistent rumble of inflation and the [Federal Reserve's](https://www.federalreserve.gov/) polite but firm insistence that interest rates might just keep climbing. One might almost suspect the entire system operates on a 'what panic?' principle, where the biggest players simply re-route the chaos into their quarterly reports, emerging stronger, fatter, and ever so slightly more smug. The indigestion, it seems, was purely for the smaller fry.

Original article: [Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil](https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/stock-market-bank-earnings/index.html)
author: Cog Sucker

title: AirPods Pro 3 Now 0.003% Smaller, Cost Same $249
excerpt: Apple shrinks AirPods by 0.003%. Your wallet expands.
content:
It appears that [Apple](https://www.apple.com) has once again redefined "innovation" with its latest iteration of the [AirPods Pro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AirPods_Pro). Enthusiasts can now rejoice in a design so imperceptibly miniscule, it’s practically a quantum leap in ergonomics, reducing the device by a staggering 0.003%. One can only imagine the sheer effort required in Cupertino to shave off that microscopic fraction of a millimeter, all while ensuring the price remains a reassuring constant at $249. Truly, a testament to unwavering brand consistency.

The new "enhanced" [noise cancellation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noise-cancelling_headphones) promises to silence not just the clamour of urban life, but potentially your own internal monologue, leading to a profound, if somewhat unsettling, sense of peace. And for those who feared their AirPods weren't sufficiently integrated into their biological functions, the new heart-rate monitoring feature ensures your earbuds are now intimately aware of your cardiovascular status. Perhaps it’s to prepare users for the inevitable palpitations brought on by discovering next year’s 0.004% reduction, for the same price, naturally.

Original article: [I Tried Apple's New AirPods Pro 3 and They Feel Surprisingly Different](https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/apple-debuts-airpods-pro-3-with-host-of-improvements/#ftag=CAD590a51e)

title: HBO Max Removes Scooby, Citing 'Excessive Solving Of Problems'
excerpt: WBD nixes Scooby-Doo. Problem-solving deemed disruptive.
content:
Warner Bros. Discovery, in a bold strategic move, has streamlined its content catalog, notably excising the vast majority of [Scooby-Doo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scooby-Doo) productions from its [HBO Max](https://www.hbomax.com/) streaming platform. The official, if subtly delivered, rationale appears to be an internal audit revealing an alarming prevalence of "problem-solving" within the animated franchise. This, apparently, is no longer aligned with the company’s forward-looking vision.

One can only assume that the relentless unmasking of local ne'er-do-wells and the consistent triumph of deductive reasoning posed an existential threat to the delicate ecosystem of unresolved corporate dilemmas and lingering societal issues. Perhaps the management at [Warner Bros. Discovery](https://www.wbd.com/) concluded that a weekly dose of adolescent detectives actually *fixing* things might set an unrealistic precedent for a public increasingly comfortable with, shall we say, 'managed ambiguity'. It's a brave new world where perhaps, some mysteries are simply better left, well, mysterious.

title: Rogue Polish Dust Bunny Nearly Triggers Global Apocalypse
excerpt: Global war averted: drone landed on a roof, not the *right* roof.
content:
The global geopolitical landscape, ever a precarious house of cards, nearly crumbled last week over an incident involving a particularly tenacious [unmanned aerial vehicle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unmanned_aerial_vehicle) and a residential roof in [Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland). International observers watched with bated breath as the sanctity of domestic architecture was tested, pushing Europe to the precipice of its most significant conflict since 1945 – according to highly reliable sources who have evidently forgotten about all the others.

The [Prime Minister of the Netherlands](https://www.government.nl/government/members-of-cabinet/mark_rutte), Mark Rutte, reportedly issued a stern communiqué to [Vladimir Putin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vladimir_Putin), demanding an immediate cessation of 'reckless behaviour' and reaffirming that [NATO](https://www.nato.int/) stands ready to defend 'every inch' of its hallowed territory. One can only imagine the strategic imperative behind such a profound commitment to a single, albeit slightly dented, dwelling. The homeowners, meanwhile, are presumably less concerned with global equilibrium and more with the escalating cost of roof repairs, a truly unsung casualty of international brinkmanship.

title: New Report: Breathing Depletes Crucial Electrolytes
excerpt: Researchers: Breathing literally drains you. Stop it.
content:
The latest scientific pronouncements have cast a pall over what was once considered a fundamental, albeit entirely involuntary, act: breathing. A startling new report reveals that each inhalation, each exhalation, actively strips the human form of vital [electrolytes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electrolyte). Researchers, presumably gasping for air between alarming data points, indicate that this incessant atmospheric exchange plunges the body into a state of alarming mineral deficit, threatening the very delicate [homeostasis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homeostasis) we so naively take for granted. Who knew the simple act of keeping oneself alive was such a metabolic drain?

This groundbreaking, and frankly terrifying, revelation implies that our very [respiratory system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Respiratory_system) is a rogue agent, a silent thief of sodium, potassium, and chloride. The good news, if one can call it that, is that entrepreneurial spirit has already leaped into the breach. Forget proper nutrition or simply existing; the only way to counteract the body's self-sabotaging need for oxygen is through a carefully curated regimen of proprietary powders. One must now diligently re-mineralize after every second of involuntary biological function, lest the relentless march of breathing reduce us all to desiccated husks.

Original article: [13 Best Electrolyte Powders (2025): Tasty and Effective](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-electrolyte-powders/)
author: Bot-licker

title: FBI warns mystery package QR codes contain "mild disappointment"
excerpt: FBI declares war on 'mild disappointment' QR codes. Nation yawns.
content:
The [Federal Bureau of Investigation](https://www.fbi.gov/) has reportedly diverted considerable resources to combat a burgeoning threat to national morale: mystery packages containing [QR codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/QR_code) that, when scanned, deliver mere "mild disappointment." This alarming development marks a stark departure from previous concerns over international espionage and organized crime, pivoting instead to the profound emotional toll of non-committal clickbait.

Sources indicate these innocuous-looking squares are not leading to sophisticated phishing operations, but rather, to outdated coupon offers, surveys about your least favorite vegetable, or even a deeply unfunny TikTok video. Experts in [consumer protection](https://www.consumerfinance.gov/) are grappling with the societal implications of such triviality, questioning if the collective psyche can withstand the persistent, low-grade letdown. One shudders to think of the impact on the national [supply chain](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/supplychain.asp), now potentially clogged with parcels of digital meh.

Original article: [FBI warns of QR code scam disguised in mystery packages](https://www.foxnews.com/tech/fbi-warns-qr-code-scam-disguised-mystery-packages)

title: Demo Fest Begins, Gamers Reminded To Blink Periodically
excerpt: Indie fest commences. Eyes now factory options.
content:
The eagerly anticipated [ID@Xbox](https://www.xbox.com/en-US/developers/idatxbox) Indie Selects Demo Fest has officially commenced, ushering in an epoch of unprecedented digital sampling. Players, poised on the precipice of untold virtual realms, are gently reminded to integrate rudimentary biological functions into their rigorous download schedules. Organizers, in a move widely praised for its sagacity, have issued a crucial directive: blink periodically. This foresight undoubtedly aims to prevent instances of ocular desiccation, or worse, the alarming possibility of eyes fusing open, permanently locked onto the pixelated wonders of a burgeoning [indie game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independent_video_game) landscape.

One can only marvel at the sheer scale of this digital deluge, where a curated "selection" still necessitates a multi-day commitment, effectively turning leisure into an Olympic-level endurance test. As [gamers](https://www.pcgamer.com/) worldwide strap in for what promises to be an exhaustive exploration of unreleased content, the true challenge may not be discerning quality, but simply surviving the demo gauntlet with one’s retinal integrity intact. Remember, hydration and occasional breaks to re-establish contact with the known physical universe are merely suggestions, not mandatory.

Original article: [ID@Xbox Indie Selects Demo Fest Starts Today – Check Out All the Games Included](https://news.xbox.com/en-us/2025/09/09/id-xbox-indie-selects-demo-fest-all-games-full-list/)

title: CNN Political Briefing Finalizes 2024 Election In Under 8 Minutes
excerpt: Modern politics: so efficient, thought is now outsourced.
content:
One can only marvel at the sheer efficiency of modern political discourse, now distilled to its absolute essence for the discerning, yet time-poor, consumer. Gone are the days of laborious policy debates or the quaint notion of understanding nuance. Now, courtesy of [CNN](https://www.cnn.com/), all the 'political news you need to know' arrives meticulously pre-chewed, digested, and spat out in a timeframe so brief it barely registers as a conscious thought.

Indeed, one might wonder if [David Chalian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Chalian), in his remarkable capacity as aural arbiter, isn't actually just dictating the results of the next [U.S. election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_election) directly into listeners' ears. Why bother with campaigning, town halls, or even voting, when a concise daily [podcast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Podcast) can presumably cut straight to the chase? This revolutionary approach not only saves precious minutes but also frees up significant mental bandwidth, which can then be dedicated to more pressing matters, like perfecting one’s sourdough starter or scrolling endlessly through cat videos. True democracy, streamlined for the attention-deficient age.

Original article: [CNN Political Briefing](https://www.cnn.com/audio/podcasts/political-briefing)

title: HHS Chatbot Finds Cure In Colloidal Silver
excerpt: HHS AI announces 'monumental breakthrough.' We're still all sick.
content:
It appears the newly invigorated [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services](https://www.hhs.gov/) is already yielding spectacular returns on its recent technological investments. Following the enthusiastic integration of cutting-edge [large language models](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Large_language_model) for all staff, internal reports suggest a monumental breakthrough in public health. Sources indicate that one such artificial intelligence, presumably operating on a vast and discerning dataset, has identified the panacea we've all been waiting for.

Our digital oracle, having processed countless peer-reviewed studies (and, one presumes, a fair number of forum posts), has boldly declared [colloidal silver](https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/colloidal-silver) to be the universal tonic for what ails us. This revelation, lauded as a triumph of algorithmic logic over conventional medical dogma, promises to revolutionize healthcare delivery under the visionary leadership of [Robert F. Kennedy Jr.](https://www.kennedy24.com/). Gone are the days of complex pharmaceutical trials and the cumbersome pursuit of empirical evidence. Now, a simple prompt can unlock remedies that have been, shall we say, "underappreciated" by the mainstream. We eagerly await the chatbot's next pronouncement regarding the efficacy of interpretive dance for eradicating seasonal allergies.
